pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cnv.scaling.autoscaler

Class AutoScaler

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cnv.scaling.autoscaler.AutoScaler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AutoScaler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Manages the creation and destruction of Instances.

    • Method Detail

      • addRunningInstance

        private void addRunningInstance(com.amazonaws.services.ec2.model.DescribeInstanceStatusRequest request)
        It waits until the Instance is running. If the Instance evolves to a state other than running, i.e. its creation failed. It tries to create it again.
        Parameters:
        request - It is a StatusRequest associated with the newly created Instance to use to request its status.

      • autoScale

        private boolean autoScale(boolean toCheckCPU)
        Calculates the sum of the Costs of all Instances, if it exceeds a certain Threshold, a new Instance is created, if it does not reach a certain Threshold, the Instance with associated minimum Cost is terminated. If no action has been taken, when it is necessary to check the CPU Utilization, it takes an approach similar to the one it did for the Costs of the Instances.
        Parameters:
        toCheckCPU - True if it is to verify the CPU Utilization, otherwise, False.
        Returns:
        True if an action was taken, otherwise, False.

      • autoScalerBoot

        private void autoScalerBoot()
        Creates the minimum number of Instances for the System to start operating.

      • checkUnhealthy

        private void checkUnhealthy()
        Detects Instances marked as Unhealthy by the LoadBalancer and replaces them.

      • fetchInstance

        private com.amazonaws.services.ec2.model.Instance fetchInstance(java.lang.String instanceId)
        Gets the the newly created Instance based on its Id.
        Parameters:
        instanceId - Id of the newly created Instance.
        Returns:
        Fetched Instance.

      • newAWS

        private void newAWS()
        Initializes AWS EC2 and CloudWatch with the credentials of our AWS account, stored in the ~/.aws Directory.

      • newInstance

        private void newInstance()
        Creates a new WebServer Instance using the Image Id, the Key Pair Name and the Security Group provided.

      • newTimer

        private void newTimer()
        Creates a Timer that performs automatic Scaling. Every 10 seconds, it checks the current associated Cost of the Instances. Every 30 seconds, it will check the CPU Utilization in AWS. Each time it performs an action, it will have a 30 seconds timeout before another action can be performed.

      • removeInstance

        private void removeInstance(java.lang.String instanceId)
        Terminates an Instance based on its Id.
        Parameters:
        instanceId - Id of the Instance to be terminated.

      • run

        public void run()
        Initializes the AutoScaler Timer.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • takeAction

        private boolean takeAction(double valueSum,
                 int valueThresholdMax,
                 int valueThresholdMin,
                 java.lang.String minValueInstanceId)
        Creates an Instance if valueSum is greater than valueThresholdMax times the number of Instances. Removes the Instance with minValueInstanceId if valueSum is less than valueThresholdMin times the number of Instances and there is more than one Instance.
        Parameters:
        valueSum - Sum of associated Cost or CPU Utilization of all Instances.
        valueThresholdMax - Maximum Threshold of associated Cost or CPU Utilization.
        valueThresholdMin - Minimum Threshold of associated Cost or CPU Utilization.
        minValueInstanceId - Id of the Instance that has the lowest associated Cost or CPU Utilization.
        Returns:
        True if an action was taken, otherwise, False.
